lexUnit.name: frustrate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to feel dissatisfied or unfulfilled.

sentence.text: It had puzzled and frustrated her that she had got nowhere .
They frustrate the interviewer who wants to know specific tangible facts about the past to assess how this information could be utilised in the future .
The use of Fabian tactics by the French frustrated the English who spent large sums on the war , but to little purpose .
It 's attitudes like that which so frustrate doctors .
The objections of his colleagues clearly frustrated him : Children in this area are not used to reading and handling books .
At best her rejection could only frustrate him .
It 's nice to see a keyboard bashing and mouse jerking game once in a while but this game lacks events and the numerous score board screens really frustrate me .
` And you do n't know how you frustrate me , " he retorted , tight-lipped , scowling at her .
It will also frustrate the operators , and discourage them from using it , so that the system falls into disrepute and founders .
` How can I possibly frustrate you ?
A stickler for realism , he was frustrated by an obstinacy in his models as strong as his own .
How often have teachers been frustrated by their inability to introduce and implement change in their schools on returning from a course ?
The individual is frustrated by the formal constraints imposed by formal organisations and creates informal activities .
` Nurses everywhere are saying that although they remain loyal to the NHS , they are frustrated by not being able to give patients the quality of care they need .
At 23 years old , Alex Watts has the presence of a man ten years his senior , tempered with a new-found impatience he knows frustrates his family and friends .
But wanting only frustrated him more .
The Australian patrols laid ambushes in the way Mike Calvert had taught them : pinprick harassment frustrated the Japanese until every misfortune was blamed on the guerrillas .
Their problem is often that there is nothing to explore except a bare concrete cell , and this frustrates them intensely .
Boswell 's footnote , even if extensive by his standards , frustrates further .
Many Western companies , frustrated by restrictions on sales to the eastern bloc , are likely to find the Soviet technology sales drive particularly galling .
Doyle said that he had been ` totally frustrated " by his two years on the board .
